Official start of the hackathon.
Start your morning with a tasty waffle breakfast.
Relaxing morning yoga session to refresh yourself.
Casual meetups with sponsors over coffee. An opportunity to network and learn from industry leaders.

event_name: MLH: Making Better Hacks, Faster with GitHub Copilot
description: A session by MLH to demonstrate how GitHub Copilot can enhance your hacking speed and creativity.
Customize your tote bags with stickers, paints, and other creative materials.

event_name: Lunch: Chicken, Beef, and Veggie Burgers
description: Enjoy a variety of burgers during lunch. Options include chicken, beef, and veggie.
Relax and de-stress with therapy dogs. A great way to recharge during the hackathon.
Capture the memories with fun props and backgrounds at the photo booth.
Drop in and discuss potential opportunities and ideas with various sponsors.
Join in the fun with bubble soccer. Bump and bounce around in an inflatable zorb.

event_name: MS Paint Bob Ross with MLH
description: Channel your inner Bob Ross with MS Paint. A relaxing painting session hosted by MLH.
An open space for participants to meet, discuss projects, and share ideas.
Cool down with a variety of ice cream flavors available as an afternoon snack.
Relax and play video games in the gaming lounge. A variety of games available for all interests.
Nutritious power bowls served for dinner, featuring a mix of grains, proteins, and vegetables.
Sing your heart out at the karaoke session. A fun way to unwind and showcase your vocal talents.
Warm up with a delicious selection of soups available during the evening snack time.
Participate in a fun trivia game. Test your knowledge and win prizes.
Dance the night away at the silent disco. Grab a headset and enjoy the music.
Test your spice tolerance in the hot sauce challenge. Prizes for participants.
Enjoy a late-night snack of classic Canadian poutine.
Wind down with a movie screening. A selection of popular films will be shown.
Start your morning with hearty breakfast bowls, packed with flavor and nutrition.
Last chance to return any borrowed hardware items.
The hacking period concludes. Prepare for project submissions.

event_time: Judging block 10 am till 1 pm Sunday, September 15th
description: Submit final projects to Dev Post and prepare for the judging process.
Return all borrowed hardware to the Shopify Hardware Hub.
Enjoy walking tacos, a fun and easy lunch option on the go.
Grab a snack, meet hackers, and learn more about each other's projects during this social hour.
Celebrate the end of the hackathon with award presentations and final remarks.
Finalists return any remaining hardware. Wrap up the weekend with live demos of finalist projects.
Join a panel discussion with founders and venture capital experts on turning Hack the North projects into startups.

event_name: What the Future - What’s Next for Generative AI?
description: A visionary panel on the future of generative AI, covering trends, industry impacts, and potential applications.
A panel on career choices in tech, discussing various roles and industries from startups to big tech.
Submit your resume for live feedback from experienced professionals, while learning helpful tips for improving it.

event_name: Creation Lab: Kickstart Your Hackathon Idea
description: Brainstorm project ideas using design thinking and team activities to kickstart your hackathon journey.
Learn Figma essentials for creating wireframes, prototypes, and design handoffs to developers.

event_name: Rapid Web Development: Everything Frontend in <1 Hour
description: Explore tools for quick frontend development, covering design, prototyping, APIs, and selective rendering.
Develop cross-platform mobile apps using Flutter, comparing SDKs and building an app for your phone.

event_name: A Dreamer’s Guide to AR/VR Development
description: Learn AR/VR app development in Unity, with a focus on Meta SDK integration and hand-tracking inputs.

event_name: Hypermedia & HTMX - A Different Approach To Full-Stack Development
description: Learn how to build dynamic web apps using HTMX with minimal JavaScript and backend versatility.

event_name: Fantastic Agents and How to Build Them
description: Build autonomous AI agents using large language models (LLMs) for your hackathon project.

event_name: Spark It Up: Igniting Big Data
description: Introduction to Apache Spark and hands-on activities using PySpark for Big Data applications.

event_name: Printed Circuit Boards 101: Building a Binary Clock
description: Design your own PCB binary clock while learning about printed circuit boards and their applications.

event_name: Intro to Rust: Oxidize the Classic Command-Line App
description: Learn Rust development by building a command-line app with basic encryption.

event_name: Hacking Web Applications: An Introduction to Common Web Vulnerabilities for CTFs and Real-Life Pentests
description: Explore common web vulnerabilities like XSS and SQL injection with hands-on pen-testing using BurpSuite.

event_name: From Pit Stop to Podium: Mastering Technical Project Management for Complex Engineering Teams
description: Learn strategies for managing diverse engineering teams in the context of building autonomous race cars.

event_name: Causal Inference: AI Beyond Correlations and ML
description: Learn the principles of causal inference and apply them using Python libraries for AI and machine learning.
An introduction to Nvidia CUDA programming using Google Colab for parallel GPU computation.

event_name: What They Don’t Tell You About Technical Interviews
description: Explore hidden aspects of technical interviews, focusing on how successful candidates stand out.
Learn how to effectively pitch your hackathon project to judges, including demoing tips and techniques.

event_name: Convex: How to Use the Convex Backend Platform to Build a Full-Stack Web App in Minutes
description: Learn how to use Convex to build full-stack web apps quickly, utilizing serverless functions and React libraries for app prototyping.

event_name: Groq: How to Use Groq Cloud for Fast AI Inference
description: See how Groq powers leading AI models like Llama 3.1, and learn how to switch seamlessly from other providers with minimal code changes.

event_name: RBC Avion Rewards – Making Your Point with Points
description: Explore RBC’s Developer Portal and APIs to leverage Avion Rewards in your projects, engaging customers with offers, cashback, and points.

event_name: Genesys: Empowering Empathetic Experiences - Unleashing the Power of Genesys Cloud APIs
description: Explore Genesys Cloud APIs to create empathetic customer experiences, from surveys to sentiment analysis and beyond.
Learn to incorporate MASV into your projects for fast and scalable data transfers, with a chance to win a $1000 CAD Amazon gift card.

event_name: Voiceflow: Building AI Agents Quickly with Voiceflow
description: Learn to build AI agents and apps using Voiceflow APIs, ideal for fast innovation and project development.

event_name: Cohere: Build an LLM Agent with Multi-Step Tool Use
description: Create smart agents using Cohere's API and language models, designed to perform complex tasks through multi-step tool usage.

event_name: Pinecone: Build a Knowledgeable Assistant with Pinecone Assistant
description: Develop AI assistants that answer complex questions about custom data using simple API calls in this hands-on workshop.
Anton Troynikov, co-founder of Chroma, will demonstrate how to use AI to build software that processes unstructured data.

event_name: MappedIn: Make a Map, Build an App (in Minutes)
description: Learn to create and deploy a custom map using MappedIn’s features in just a few minutes during this interactive workshop.

event_name: CSE: The Most Interesting Organization That You’ve Never Heard Of
description: Learn about Canada's cryptological agency, foreign signals intelligence, and its lead role in foreign cyber operations.
Intuit’s workshop on their development tools and APIs.

event_name: AWS: Unleashing the Power of AI/ML: From Industry Disruption to Text Generation with AWS Bedrock
description: Learn how AI/ML is used in the industry with AWS, including a short workshop on text generation and summarization using Amazon Bedrock.
Join this hands-on workshop to level up your cloud development skills using Docker and Defang for cloud apps.

event_name: Warp: How to Become a Command Line Connoisseur
description: Explore terminal tips and tricks to increase productivity and learn the fascinating history of terminals in this deep dive.
Test your skills by uploading a file to a local server. Challenges include network failures and ensuring file integrity. Prizes for top performers.
Crack a complex code inspired by trading. First 3 to solve it win exclusive DRW swag.
Create a graph visualization of a Python codebase. Use tools like AST, Tree-Sitter, and NetworkX to represent and analyze the code.
Explore retrieval-augmented generation systems to reduce model hallucinations and integrate private data.
Learn about Aria, a low-latency framework for handling data races and process failures in trading infrastructure.
Discover how AI is revolutionizing technology and how you can use it to innovate in your projects.
Get expert help with sponsor APIs and project submissions. Drop by for advice and assistance.
